ubermenu-item ubermenu-item-type-custom ubermenu-item-object-custom ubermenu-item-65834 ubermenu-item-auto ubermenu-item-header ubermenu-item-level-1 ubermenu-column ubermenu-column-2-3 ubermenu-hide-mobile

div.p: Broadalbin-Perth Central School District is located at the foothills of the Adirondacks and along the shores of the Great Sacandaga Lake. The district focuses on preparing students for college and careers through an innovative and high-quality pre-K through grade 12 program designed to help students reach their academic potential and develop a desire for lifelong learning.

With a mission of striving for excellence, Broadalbin-Perth consistently has one of the highest graduation rates in the region. The district’s four schools thrive as centers of activity and enjoy outstanding community support.

ubermenu-item ubermenu-item-type-custom ubermenu-item-object-custom ubermenu-item-66634 ubermenu-item-auto ubermenu-item-header ubermenu-item-level-1 ubermenu-column ubermenu-column-2-3 ubermenu-hide-mobile

div.p: Broadalbin-Perth Central School District offers a rigorous, innovative and high-quality academic program that meets children where they are, whether they require enrichment or need extra help.

The district offers a pre-K through grade 12 program throughout which students continually build on their skills. This allows each student to reach his or her academic potential and develop a desire for lifelong learning.

Broadalbin-Perth is dedicated to preparing students for college and careers by providing educational programs that align with individual students’ interests, talents and needs, as well as the state Department of Education's learning standards.

div.p: The interscholastic athletic program at the Broadalbin-Perth Central School District is designed to develop healthy and wholesome living habits and to allow students an opportunity to demonstrate their special abilities.

Broadalbin-Perth is a highly competitive member of the Foothills Council and fields a wide range of interscholastic sports teams for students each season, including modified-, junior varsity- and varsity-level sports.

ubermenu-item ubermenu-item-type-custom ubermenu-item-object-custom ubermenu-item-69988 ubermenu-item-auto ubermenu-item-header ubermenu-item-level-1 ubermenu-column ubermenu-column-2-3 ubermenu-hide-mobile

div.p: The Broadalbin-Perth Central School District spans portions of Fulton, Montgomery and Saratoga counties and includes parts of the towns of Broadalbin, Perth, Amsterdam, Galway, Edinburg, Johnstown, Mayfield, Northampton and Providence.

Broadalbin-Perth thrives because of the support of the communities it serves. As a hub of activity in the region, the school district strives to be a source of pride, encouraging community participation in and attendance at sporting events, drama productions, band and chorus concerts, and many other activities.

div.p: Beyond classroom instruction, the Broadalbin-Perth Central School District takes pride in offering top quality services to its students.

The district is committed to providing safe transportation, nutritious meals and integrating technology into the learning process. BPCSD also believes strongly in the importance of transparency and communication between parents and the community and the school district.
The work of the departments listed in this section is essential to the district’s mission of striving for excellence.

div.h4: 20 Pine Street, Broadalbin, New York 12025 • Phone: 518.954.2500 • Fax: 518.954.2509 • Stephen Tomlinson, Superintendent
div.p:
This site is maintained by the Broadalbin-Perth communications team, according to the Web publishing guidelines of the Broadalbin-Perth Central School District.
© 2015 All rights reserved. Produced and maintained in cooperation with the Capital Region BOCES Communications Service.
Some files on this site require the Adobe Acrobat Reader. Download the Adobe Reader.

The Broadalbin-Perth Central School District is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees, students or others, with regard to employment, admission, or access to its programs and activities, on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, gender, disability, or age, and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. Further, the District does not discriminate on the basis of religion or creed, sexual orientation, military status, genetic status, marital status, domestic violence victim status, criminal arrest or conviction record, or any other basis prohibited by state or federal non-discrimination laws.

Inquiries or concerns regarding civil rights compliance by the District may be referred to the District’s Superintendent of Schools as its designated Civil Rights Compliance Officer/Title IX Coordinator by mail at 20 Pine Street, Broadalbin, New York 12025; by telephone at (518) 954-2500; and/or by email at tomlinsons@bpcsd.org. Inquiries and complaints may also be directed to the U.S. Department of Education, New York Office for Civil Rights, 32 Old Slip, 26th Floor, New York, New York 10005; telephone: (646) 428-3800; electronic mail: OCR.NewYork@ed.gov.
